channel.title: Need help with Funny Command

item.title: Need help with Funny Command
item.dc:creator: @zithro zithro
item.description:
@zithro wrote:

Well, I recently added a command that I found on these forums, and I wanted to test it out. The command is the ::setname command (sets username of who you want to say), and the ::say command (what you want that username to say)

I have everything done, and it all compiled correctly, but when I attempt to use it in the server, the ::set works perfectly, but the ::message always tells me that the username is invalid or the player is offline

Here’s what I found on the guide

Code:

public String makeMsg;

Code:public int makesay = 0; Now declare these voids

Code:public void tehSay() { txt4 = makeMsg; string4UpdateRequired = true; updateRequired = true; //sendMessage("Completed Say."); }

Code:public void say(String msg){ txt4 = msg; string4UpdateRequired = true; updateRequired = true; }

Now add this to either

Code:public void process

or

Code:public boolean process

Code:if(makesay == 1) { makesay = 0; //sendMessage("Completing say..."); tehSay(); }
Add these commands in

Code:public void customcommands

Code:[code]if (command.startsWith(“say”) && (playerRights >= 3)) // Made By Owned Pl0xs
{
if(makeMsg != null) {
try{
String otherPName = command.substring(4);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);
if(otherPIndex != -1) {
client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];
p.makeMsg = makeMsg;
p.makesay = 1;
sendMessage(“Now making the player say : '”+makeMsg+"’.");
}
else { sendMessage(“That name does not exist, or they are not online.”); }
} catch(Exception e) { sendMessage(“Try entering a name you want to tele to you…”); }
}
else if(makeMsg == null) {
sendMessage(“Please use ::setname NAMEHERE to set the person who will say the message.”)
}
}

Code:
if(command.startsWith(“setname”) && (playerRights >= 3)) // Made By Owned Pl0xs
{
String setMsg = command.substring(8);
makeMsg = setMsg;
sendMessage(“Your message has now been set to '”+makeMsg+"’");
}[/code]

That’s what the guide said, and the only problem is the ::say, any help is appreciated. Thanks
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 19, 2008, 08:36:36 AM[/size][hr]nobody?
